intro: Diplandra montana, commonly known as the mountain diplandra, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, hairy stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late summer to early autumn. Diplandra montana is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, making it a hardy plant in arid and semi-arid environments.
